summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2020 between U.S. Attorney's Office staff and Bureau of Prisons/Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) staff regarding logistical issues in arranging legal phone calls for Ghislaine Maxwell with her defense counsel while she was in custody, in the days leading up to her arraignment.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; the defense counsel is attempting to schedule legal calls with her while she is held at MDC prior to her arraignment.

persons.name: Mr. Everdell
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell; the MDC is asked to provide daily 10:00 AM legal calls to his number.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Issued a directive for the parties in U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell to file a letter by 9pm on July 6, 2020, prompting the initial urgent request for a legal call.

connections.description: Defense counsel Mr. Everdell is attempting to schedule legal phone calls with his client, Ghislaine Maxwell, who is in custody.

events.title: Judge Nathan's filing deadline
events.description: Judge Nathan directs parties in U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell to file a letter by 9pm, prompting an urgent request for Maxwell to have a legal call with her defense counsel.

events.title: Scheduled arraignment for Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment is scheduled for Tuesday, July 14, 2020, which is the reason for establishing standing daily legal calls in the preceding week.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was in federal custody at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) in July 2020.
Her defense counsel, Mr. Everdell, was having logistical difficulties scheduling legal phone calls with her, prompting intervention from the U.S. Attorney's Office.
A joint protocol existed between EDNY and SDNY for defense counsel to request legal calls for inmates at MDC, which Maxwell's counsel initially seemed unaware of or confused by.
A standing daily 10:00 AM legal call was established for Maxwell with her counsel for the week leading up to her July 14, 2020 arraignment.
The emails reveal the procedural coordination required between the prosecution, defense, and prison administration in a high-profile case.
